title: rwinepredict-vignette
text: Data cleaning preprocessing critical first step data analysis workflow. clean_wine_data() function simplifies process specifically wine datasets. function removes NA values also scales numeric columns converts target column factor, preparing dataset analysis. function accepts two parameters: data: dataframe containing wine dataset cleaned. target_col: name target column dataset want convert factor show example use function ‘winequality-red.csv’ dataset can found

title: rwinepredict-vignette
text: Visualization key understanding distribution variables dataset. distribution_bar() function creates bar chart display frequency category within variable. Parameters: - data: dataset data frame tibble. - x: unquoted name column want plot x-axis. ’s can visualize distribution ‘quality’ variable winequality dataset:
code: dist_plot <- distribution_bar(wine_data, x = "quality",                                title = "Distribution of Wine Quality",                                x_label = "Quality",                                y_label = "Frequency") print(dist_plot)

title: rwinepredict-vignette
text: Transforming numerical data categorical data can provide intuitive insights analysis. quality() function converts numerical scores column dataframe categorical values, “bad” “good”. Parameters: - data: dataframe containing ‘quality’ column. ’s example demonstrates apply transformation:

title: rwinepredict-vignette
text: Understanding relationship two variables essential many analyses. scatter_plot() function generates scatter plot purpose, providing visual means detect patterns, trends, outliers two quantitative variables. Parameters: data: data frame containing dataset. x_var: column name x-axis variable. y_var: column name y-axis variable. x_label: Label x-axis. y_label: Label y-axis. Find example explore relationship ‘alcohol’ content ‘quality’:
code: scatter <- scatter_plot(wine_data, x_var = "alcohol", y_var = "quality",               title = "Alcohol Content vs. Wine Quality",               x_label = "Alcohol (%)",               y_label = "Quality") scatter

title: Assists with exploratory data analysis
text: clean_data.R: Performs data cleaning preprocessing wine dataset. drops N/values, converts target column factor, scales numeric columns. distribution_bar.R: function generating bar distribution variable based frequency quality.R: function transforms ‘quality’ column dataframe categorical values “bad” “good”. scatter_plot.R: Function plot scatter plot

what: Place within the R Package Ecosystem
title: Assists with exploratory data analysis
text: rwinepredict may initially appear overlap functionalities established R packages like ggplot2 dplyr. However, differentiates tailoring function specific nuances wine quality analysis, enhancing usability relevance specific data sets. rwinepredict includes visualization functions similar ggplot2, distribution_bar scatter_plot, customized predefined settings optimized wine data. example, scatter_plot automatically adjusts plot dimensions aesthetics best display relationship physicochemical properties wine quality, making visualizations immediately useful appealing analysis context. clean_data function goes beyond basic capabilities dplyr’s select filter. integrates multiple data cleaning steps essential preparing wine data analysis, converting quality scores numeric binary scale directly supports project’s focus classifying wine quality. quality function specifically caters wine industry’s standards transforming numeric quality ratings practical categories (“bad” “good”). directly aligns industry practices categorizations significantly influence production marketing strategies. function rwinepredict designed work cohesively within package’s ecosystem. seamless integration facilitates efficient analysis workflow, data cleaning, transformation, visualization just isolated tasks interconnected steps enhance overall analytical output

title: Assists with exploratory data analysis
text: rwinepredict package offers suite functions tailored facilitate analysis wine data, focusing cleaning, visualization, transformation. can use functions effectively:

title: Assists with exploratory data analysis
text: clean_wine_data function preprocesses wine dataset removing N/values, converting target column factor, scaling numeric columns, preparing analysis.
code: # Load data data <- read.csv('wine_data.csv', header = TRUE, sep = ";") # Clean data cleaned_data <- clean_wine_data(data, target_col = 'quality')

title: Assists with exploratory data analysis
text: distribution_bar function creates bar chart visualize distribution specified variable based frequency. function ideal understanding frequency distribution variables like wine quality pH levels.
code: # Plot distribution of a variable dist_plot <- distribution_bar(cleaned_data, "quality", title = "Distribution of Wine Quality", x_label = "Quality", y_label = "Frequency") print(dist_plot)

title: Assists with exploratory data analysis
text: quality function categorizes ‘quality’ column ‘bad’ ‘good’ based predefined thresholds. transformation useful simplifying quality assessment process.

title: Assists with exploratory data analysis
text: scatter_plot function plots scatter plot visualize relationship two variables. function includes aesthetic customizations reference line aid visual comparisons. functions designed work seamlessly typical R workflows, enhancing analysis wine data addressing specific needs preprocessing, visualization, categorical transformation.
code: # Create a scatter plot scatter_plot_data <- scatter_plot(transformed_data, "alcohol", "quality", title = "Alcohol vs. Quality", x_label = "Alcohol Content", y_label = "Quality") print(scatter_plot_data)
